message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
public class Aplikacija {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        File file = new File("Psi.txt");
        Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
        ArrayList<Pes> dogs = new ArrayList<>();
        for (int i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
            System.out.println("Vpišite ime!");
            String Ime = input.nextLine();
            System.out.println("Vpišite pasmo!");
            String Pasma = input.nextLine();
            System.out.println("Izberite starost!");
            int Starost = input.nextInt();
            System.out.println("Izberite tezo!");
            double Teza = input.nextDouble();
            input.nextLine(); // consume newline left-over
            Pes Pes1 = new Pes();
            Pes1.setIme(Ime);
            Pes1.setPasma(Pasma);
            Pes1.setStarost(Starost);
            Pes1.setTeza(Teza);
            dogs.add(Pes1);
        }
        input.close();
        try {
            PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(file));
            for (Pes dog : dogs) {
                writer.write(dog.getIme() + ", " + dog.getPasma() + ", " + dog.getStarost() + ", " + dog.getTeza() + "\n");
            }
            writer.close();
        } catch (IOException e) {
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}
```
<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that you are not adding the created Pes object to the ArrayList. You need to create the ArrayList outside the loop and then add the Pes object to it inside the loop. After that, you can use a PrintWriter to write the data of each Pes object in the ArrayList to the file. The PrintWriter.write method is used to write the string representation of the Pes object to the file. Each field of the Pes object is separated by a comma and each Pes object is written on a new line.
